citations.narrative:
The water trough for the pigs is not being maintained in a clean and sanitary manner. The water was muddy and opaque.
When the water was drained, a large amount of mud was present at the bottom of the receptacle. Additionally, one of the
water troughs in the pasture for the goats, sheep, and cattle has green algae growing along the walls and bottom surface.
The water in this trough was clear. Water receptacles that are not kept clean can lead to decreased water consumption by
the animals, contaminated drinking water and potential disease or illness. The facility took measures to drain and clean
the pig water trough and refill with clear, potable water during the inspection. Correct by ensuring all water receptacles are
maintained in a clean and sanitary manner. Correct by October 20, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
